label: ISS overhead
info:
Gives you a forecast of the next viewable arrival of the International Space Station (valid until January 2031)

How does it work? It checks an RSS feed for your location to check for upcoming arrival times for the ISS.

There's an ISS card for Lovelace and you can
set notifications on your mobile phone and
Google / Nest smart speaker. Notifications are set  to be 10 minutes before the ISS is overhead and when it is overhead. 

The notification will tell you from what direction and angle above the horizon the ISS will arrive, how long it will be visible and it what direction and angle above the horizon it will disappear.

You can adjust the degrees above the horizon for getting notifications, from 0° to 50°. NASA's Spot the Station website suggests making the minimum rising angle of 40° above the horizon, but this depends on how much open sky you can see from your location.

Data is pulled from an RSS feed for your location, which you can get from https://spotthestation.nasa.gov/

For example, in Melbourne Australia where I am, the URL is https://spotthestation.nasa.gov/sightings/view.cfm?country=Australia&region=Victoria&city=Melbourne 

On that page, get the RSS feed URL and enter that into the Feedparser node in the top left.

In my example, the RSS feed is https://spotthestation.nasa.gov/sightings/indexrss.cfm?country=Australia&region=Victoria&city=Melbourne

REQUIREMENTS

Needs "node-red-node-feedparser" added to the palette in Node RED. I _think_ you get prompted to add this if you don't have it installed on Node RED already.


ADDITIONS YOU CAN ADD
---------------------

Look in the comments for spots where you could
add some additional checks to stop announcements when people are asleep or if who are home aren't interested in the ISS.


MAKE ANNOUNCEMENTS ON SPEAKER?

At our house, I have a sub-flow that checks to 
see if announcements on the speaker are allowed.

For example, if it is overnight, no announcements.

If I've set a "do not disturb" mode, then again no announcements.

ARE PEOPLE HOME WHO ARE INTERESTED IN THE ISS?

If only certain people are interested in the ISS
announcements on the speaker, you could
add a check here to see if they are home. 

If they are home, there's an announcement.

If they aren't home, there's silence.

name: sensor config for Varken InfluxDB Size

TempStats_BOM
query:
import "timezone" option location = timezone.location(name: "Australia/Sydney")

minMaxMean = (tables=<-) =>
  tables
    |> reduce(
      identity: {count: 0.0, sum: 0.0, min: 0.0, max: 0.0, mean: 0.0},
      fn: (r, accumulator) => ({
        count: accumulator.count + 1.0,
        sum: r._value + accumulator.sum,
        min: if accumulator.count == 0.0 then r._value else if r._value < accumulator.min then r._value else accumulator.min,
        max: if accumulator.count == 0.0 then r._value else if r._value > accumulator.max then r._value else accumulator.max,
        mean: (r._value + accumulator.sum) / (accumulator.count + 1.0)
      })
    )
    |> drop(columns: ["count", "sum"])
    |> duplicate(column: "_stop", as: "_time")

data = from(bucket: "homeassistant")
  |> range(start: -1y)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "°C")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["entity_id"] == "tamworth_airport_temp")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> drop(columns: ["friendly_name"])
  //|> filter(fn: (r) => r._value != 0.00)
  //|> aggregateWindow(every: 1d9h, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> minMaxMean()
  |> yield()

name: RainStats_Home
query:
import "timezone" option location = timezone.location(name: "Australia/Sydney")

minMaxMean = (tables=<-) =>
  tables
    |> reduce(
      identity: {count: 0.0, sum: 0.0, min: 0.0, max: 0.0, mean: 0.0},
      fn: (r, accumulator) => ({
        count: accumulator.count + 1.0,
        sum: r._value + accumulator.sum,
        min: if accumulator.count == 0.0 then r._value else if r._value < accumulator.min then r._value else accumulator.min,
        max: if accumulator.count == 0.0 then r._value else if r._value > accumulator.max then r._value else accumulator.max,
        mean: (r._value + accumulator.sum) / (accumulator.count + 1.0)
      })
    )
    //|> drop(columns: ["count", "sum"])
    |> duplicate(column: "_stop", as: "_time")

data = from(bucket: "homeassistant")
  |> range(start: -1y)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "mm")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["entity_id"] == "tempest_st_00056115_rain_today")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> drop(columns: ["friendly_name"])
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r._value != 0.00)
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1d, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> minMaxMean()
  |> yield()

name: InfluxDBSize
query: SELECT max("diskBytes")/1024/1024 AS "value" FROM "_internal"."monitor"."shard" WHERE time > now() - 1m AND "database"='homeassistant' FILL(null) tz('Australia/Sydney')

func: rbei

name: InfluxDBSize
query: SELECT max("diskBytes")/1024/1024 AS "value" FROM "_internal"."monitor"."shard" WHERE time > now() - 1m AND "database"='varken' AND "retentionPolicy"='varken 30d-1h' FILL(null) tz('Australia/Sydney')

name: InfluxDBSize
query: SELECT max("diskBytes")/1024/1024 AS "value" FROM "_internal"."monitor"."shard" WHERE time > now() - 1m AND "database"='unifi' FILL(null) tz('Australia/Sydney')

name: UniFi_UAP
query: SELECT last("ip") AS "Address", last("uptime") AS "Uptime", last("last_seen") *1000 AS "Last Seen", last("cpu") AS "CPU", last("user-num_sta") AS "Users", last("guest-num_sta") AS "Guests", last("stat_rx_bytes") AS "rxbytes", last("stat_tx_bytes") AS "txbytes" FROM "unifi"."autogen"."uap" WHERE time >= now() - 5m GROUP BY "name", "model", "serial", "site_name", "source", "type", "version", "mac"

name: UniFi_USG
query: SELECT last("uptime") AS "Uptime", last("ip") AS "Address", last("bytes") AS "Data" FROM "unifi"."autogen"."usg" WHERE time >= now() - 1h GROUP BY "name", "model", "serial", "site_name", "mac", "version", "source", "type"

name: Data
Uptime
Uptime
UniFi_USW
query: SELECT last("uptime") AS "Uptime", last("rx_bytes") AS "rxbytes", last("tx_bytes") AS "txbytes" FROM "unifi"."autogen"."usw" WHERE time >= now() - 1h GROUP BY "name", "model", "serial", "site_name", "mac", "version", "source", "type"

name: RX Bytes
Uptime
TX Bytes
RX Bytes
TX Bytes
UniFi_USG_WWW
query: SELECT last("uptime") AS "uptime", last("drops") AS "drops", last("latency") AS "latency", last("tx_bytes-r") AS "tx_bytes", last("rx_bytes-r") AS "rx_bytes", last("speedtest_lastrun") AS "speedtest_lastrun"  FROM "unifi"."autogen"."subsystems" WHERE ("subsystem" = 'www') AND time >= now() - 3h and time <= now() - 5s

name: TX Bytes
Uptime
RX Bytes
InfluxDBSize
query: SELECT max("diskBytes")/1024/1024 AS "value" FROM "_internal"."monitor"."shard" WHERE time > now() - 1m AND "database"='adsb' FILL(null) tz('Australia/Sydney')

name: RX Bytes
Uptime
TX Bytes
UniFi_UAP_SSID
query: SELECT last("num_sta") as clients FROM "unifi"."autogen"."uap_vaps" WHERE time >= now() - 5m GROUP BY "essid" FILL(null)

name: Max intensity 7 days
query:
select time, max("intensity") 
from(SELECT moving_average("deriv", 60) as intensity 
FROM( SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1h) as deriv 
FROM "homeassistant"."autogen"."mm" 
WHERE time > now() - 7d 
AND ("entity_id" = 'netatmo_brisbane_street_rain_sum_rain_24' 
or "entity_id" = 'weather_outside_rain_24hr' 
or "entity_id" = 'tempest_st_00056115_rain_today') 
GROUP BY time(1m)  fill(linear) ) fill(null))

name: X Hour AEP
Last Intensity
query:
select time, last(intensity) as max from 
(SELECT moving_average("non_negative_derivative", 60) as intensity 
FROM(SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1h) 
FROM "homeassistant"."autogen"."mm" 
WHERE ("entity_id" = 'netatmo_brisbane_street_rain_sum_rain_24' 
or "entity_id" = 'weather_outside_rain_24hr' 
or "entity_id" = 'tempest_st_00056115_rain_today') 
AND time > now() - 365d 
GROUP BY time(1m)  fill(previous)) fill(0)) 
where intensity > 0

name: Max intensity 7 days
query:
import "timezone" option location = timezone.location(name: "Australia/Sydney")

from(bucket: "homeassistant")
  |> range(start: -7d)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "mm")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["entity_id"] == "tempest_st_00056115_rain_today")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "value")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1m, fn: mean)
  |> derivative(unit: 1h, nonNegative: true, columns: ["_value"], timeColumn: "_time")
  |> movingAverage(n: 5)
  |> last()
  |> yield()

name: MoviesCount
query:
from(bucket: "varken")
  |> range(start: -1d, stop: now())
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "Tautulli")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["type"] == "library_stats")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "total")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["section_name"] == "Movies")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 5s, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

name: TVShowCount
query:
from(bucket: "varken")
  |> range(start: -1d, stop: now())
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "Tautulli")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["type"] == "library_stats")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "total")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["section_name"] == "TV Shows")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 5s, fn: last, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "last")

name: TVShowsAdded24hrs
query:
from(bucket: "varken")
  |> range(start: -1d, stop: now())
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "Tautulli")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["type"] == "library_stats")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "episodes")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["section_name"] == "TV Shows")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 1d, fn: spread, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield()

name: Pick Random Item
Flights_Now
query:
from(bucket: "adsb")
  |> range(start: -5m)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "adsb_icao" and r["_field"] == "messages")
  |>group()
  |> unique(column:"hex")
  |> count(column:"hex")

name: Max_Distance
query:
div = (tables=<-) => tables
    |> map(fn: (r) => ({r with _value: float(v: r._value) / 1000.0}))

    
from(bucket: "readsb")
  |> range(start: -15m)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["host"] == "readsb")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "max_distance_in_metres")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 15m, fn: max, createEmpty: false)
  |> div()

return msg;

name: Send to MC HASS app - ISS arrives soon
Send to MC HASS app - ISS is here
Notification of arrival in 10 minutes (open comment)
info:
This pulls in the time for the next arrival
from the variable

input_datetime.iss_next_overhead_date_time

It triggers a notification 10 minutes before the
arrival time, then triggers a notification
that it is now arriving

name: Send to MC HASS app - timeout 5s
data: {"title":"🛰 ISS is overhead for XXX minutes 🛰","message":"The ISS will arrive at  from   reaching a maximum height of  above the horizon. After minutes, it will leave .","data":{"chronometer":true,"when":"16:13:00 19-July-2021","timeout":600,"tag":"iss","ttl":86400,"priority":"high"}}

name: Set RSS feed last updated date and time
10 sec pause while feed data is downloaded
When was RSS feed last generated by NASA?
New message, once ISS has passed overhead
Did a payload meet the criteria?
Reset RSS feed updated to date
Reset RSS feed updated to date
Initial setup and check every 5 minutes
Put your ISS RSS feed in the Feedparser node below
READ ME FIRST
info:
Gives you a forecast of the next viewable arrival of the International Space Station (valid until January 2031)

How does it work? It checks an RSS feed for your location to check for upcoming arrival times for the ISS.

There's an ISS card for Lovelace and you can
set notifications on your mobile phone and
Google / Nest smart speaker. Notifications are set  to be 10 minutes before the ISS is overhead and when it is overhead. 

The notification will tell you from what direction and angle above the horizon the ISS will arrive, how long it will be visible and it what direction and angle above the horizon it will disappear.

You can adjust the degrees above the horizon for getting notifications, from 0° to 50°. NASA's Spot the Station website suggests making the minimum rising angle of 40° above the horizon, but this depends on how much open sky you can see from your location.

Data is pulled from an RSS feed for your location, which you can get from https://spotthestation.nasa.gov/

For example, in Melbourne Australia where I am, the URL is https://spotthestation.nasa.gov/sightings/view.cfm?country=Australia&region=Victoria&city=Melbourne 

On that page, get the RSS feed URL and enter that into the Feedparser node in the top left.

In my example, the RSS feed is https://spotthestation.nasa.gov/sightings/indexrss.cfm?country=Australia&region=Victoria&city=Melbourne

REQUIREMENTS

Needs "node-red-node-feedparser" added to the palette in Node RED. I _think_ you get prompted to add this if you don't have it installed on Node RED already.


ADDITIONS YOU CAN ADD
---------------------

Look in the comments for spots where you could
add some additional checks to stop announcements when people are asleep or if who are home aren't interested in the ISS.


MAKE ANNOUNCEMENTS ON SPEAKER?

At our house, I have a sub-flow that checks to 
see if announcements on the speaker are allowed.

For example, if it is overnight, no announcements.

If I've set a "do not disturb" mode, then again no announcements.

ARE PEOPLE HOME WHO ARE INTERESTED IN THE ISS?

If only certain people are interested in the ISS
announcements on the speaker, you could
add a check here to see if they are home. 

If they are home, there's an announcement.

If they aren't home, there's silence.

name: INTERESTED PEOPLE HOME? Could go here (see note)
info:
If only certain people are interested in the ISS
announcements on the speaker, you could
add a check here to see if they are home. 

If they are home, there's an announcement.

If they aren't home, there's silence.

name: MAKE ANNOUNCEMENT CHECK? Could go here (see note)
info:
At our house, I have a sub-flow that checks to 
see if announcements on the speaker are allowed.

For example, if it is overnight, no announcements.

If I've set a "do not disturb" mode, then again no
announcements

name: Plane data
Important note about the entity node
info:
You must install the Node Red HA integration!

Check the docs for this node. 

https://github.com/zachowj/hass-node-red

name: BuildURL
Format Album Art URL
func:
msg.payload = 'http://homeassistant:8123' + msg.data.new_state.attributes.entity_picture
return msg;
